itemDescription: British dramatist, poet, novelist, translator and essayist (1874-1945)

wikipedia_page.main: Maurice Baring  (27 April 1874 – 14 December 1945) was an English man of letters, known as a dramatist, poet, novelist, translator and essayist, and also as a travel writer and war correspondent. During World War I, Baring served in the Intelligence Corps and Royal Air Force.
